bug.author: msbuckas
bug.summary: ProfileReport: output not displaying correctly in JupyterLab2.0
bug.description:
Report not displaying in JupyterLab output cell Here are the contents of the [IN] and [OUT] cells Cell [IN] <denchmark-code>import pandas_profiling as pf pf.ProfileReport(ts) </denchmark-code>
Cell[Out] <denchmark-code>Tab(children=(HTML(value='<div id="overview-content" class="row variable spacing">\n <div class="row">\n â€¦ Report generated with pandas-profiling. </denchmark-code>
Version information:
Windows: 10 Python version: 3.7.6 Environment: Conda + JupyterLab JupyterLab: 2.0.0 Pandas: 1.0.1 pandas_profiling: 2.4.0

comments.comment: You probably need to enable the widgets: jupyter nbextension enable --py widgetsnbextension <denchmark-link:https://ipywidgets.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_install.html>https://ipywidgets.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_install.html</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sbrugman>@sbrugman</denchmark-link> It says the conda install enables it! But I ran the command anyway. <denchmark-code>>jupyter nbextension enable --py widgetsnbextension Enabling notebook extension jupyter-js-widgets/extension... - Validating: ok </denchmark-code>
Did not make a difference to the output in JupyterLab!

FYI I haven't got around to debugging this 'ipywidgets' issue yet! My workaround is to write to file. It actually kinda suits my workflow. And since I'm not blocked by this issue I'm not focusing on getting this fixed with any urgency.

You probably need to enable the widgets: jupyter nbextension enable --py widgetsnbextension https://ipywidgets.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_install.html
Although I would agree this isn't the responsibility of PP, but would be great to have such tips in the Docs somewhere so we can always check if we have the necessary/minimum installation in place.

I currently have ipywidgets 7.5 in my conda env. I see there is a release candidiate out for 8.0 which is intended to be fully on par with the jlab2 changes. I will revisit this issue when there is a stable ipywidgets 8.0
